did.abstract: The collection includes ledgers and pages of ledgers with financial records of the Virginia Agricultural and Mechanical College and Polytechnic Institute. It contains a listing of receipts from 1901-1906, a listing of Bond Holders under the Act of March 5, 1900, a listing of expenditures from 1900-1908, and insurance records and valuations for policies commencing 1906-1914.

acqinfo.p: The Virginia Agricultural and Mechanical College and Polytechnic Institute Financial Ledgers, 1900-1914 were donated to Special Collections in 2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Virginia Agricultural and Mechanical College and Polytechnic Institute Financial Ledgers, 1900-1914 was completed in April 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Two ledgers contain what appears to be an identical listing of Holders of Bonds under the Act of March 5, 1900. These ledgers also contain various campus expenditures from 1900-1908. The Ledger 1900-1903 lists the following categories of expenditures: New Barracks, New Shops, Infirmary, Science Hall, President House, Equipment, Incidentals, Heat and Power, Barm, Furniture, Machinery, Willis House. Ledger 1900-1908 includes expenditures in the following categories: New Barracks, New Shops, Infirmary, Science Hall, Agricultural Hall, Equipment, Incidentals, Steam Heat, Water Works, and Building Fund.
Four loose leaves of ledger pages contain an undated listing of insurance records includes compus building valuations, insurers, and other insurance information. The Poluicies commence 1906-1914.

bioghist.head: Historical
bioghist.p: Virginia Agricultural and Mechanical College was under the administration of John M. McBryde from 1891-1907, Paul Brandon Barringer from 1907-1913, and Joseph D. Eggleston from 1913-1919. Many records were lost in a fire in 1905.
